newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan stocks close slightly higher amid caution.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan stocks close slightly higher amid caution.

text.p: Taiwan share prices erased early losses to finish slightly higher on Wednesday, but sentiment was cautious as the index inched towards 6,600, a key technical and psychological resistance level, brokers said.
The weighted index ended 20.58 points or 0.32 percent higher at 6,499.02, having recovered from an opening low of 6,452.37. Turnover was T$45.13 billion.
"Profit-taking pressure is expected to intensify as the index inches higher," said Michael Chien of China Securities.
State efforts to boost Taiwan's economy and Wall Street's recent gains helped to prevent a sharp fall, they said.
High-tech and electronics shares rose for a second day, buoyed by the sector's strong recent rebound on Wall Street.
The electronics and machinery sector was up 1.17 percent.

Most-active issue Acer Inc was up 90 cents or 2.3 percent to T$40.1 while its affiliate, Acer Sertek Co, soared the daily seven percent limit to T$37.4 on its listing debut. Brokers said the newcomer's "honeymoon" could last a few more days. Textiles also were strong on improving profit outlooks, up 1.44 percent. Hualon advanced 40 cents or 1.63 percent to T$25.
Reports of a T$1.05 billion banknote fraud scandal involving two local securities brokerages had not had a significant impact on the market, brokers said.
Brokers saw a slowly firming trend for the market, but said the performance of the heavily weighted financials would determine whether the index could breach the key resistance.
A range of 6,400-6,500 was seen for Thursday.
